intro: Plagiogyria euphlebia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bladdernut, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptic to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, and it produces distinctive, fleshy, three-lobed capsules as fruit. Plagiogyria euphlebia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and mountainous regions.
